entry.title: Build a Blog With Octopress on Github
entry.content:
Before start, please make sure you have github, ruby, rvm installed.

Setup Octopress

Clone octopress repo

git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git your_repo cd your_repo

Install dependent gems

gem install bundler bundle install

Search for a theme to install

rake install

Will talk later about how to install a customized theme

Deploy it on Github

I hosted my blog with Github Pages, so that I can only use commit and push to publish my posts. If there are multipul authors, it still easy to handle with git commands.

Goto github and create a new repo named as username.github.io. Then github pages will use the master branch as the public directory on a web server, serving up all the files at your Pages url http://username.github.io

rake setup_github_pages

Note: When you copy the url from github, please remember to remove the suffix ".git". So the url should be something like this "git@github.com:username/username.github.io". Cause if you get the wrong url, it may not report any error :(

This command will:

  1. Ask you for your Github Pages repository url.
  2. Rename the remote pointing to imathis/octopress from ‘origin’ to ‘octopress’
  3. Add your Github Pages repository as the default origin remote.
  4. Switch the active branch from master to source.
  5. Configure your blog’s url according to your repository.
  6. Setup a master branch in the _deploy directory for deployment.

Then run:

rake gen_deploy

This will generate and deploy your blog on your site.

Now, if you visit http://username.github.io, it should be your site !

Configuring Your Octopress

vi _config.yml

Go to edit config.yml for site title, author, etc. And some third party account info.

Intergated third party settings:

  • Github - List your github repositories in the sidebar
  • Twitter - Setup a sidebar twitter feed, follow button, and tweet button (for sharing posts and pages).
  • Google Plus One - Setup sharing for posts and pages on Google’s plus one network.
  • Pinboard - Share your recent Pinboard bookmarks in the sidebar.
  • Delicious - Share your recent Delicious bookmarks in the sidebar.
  • Disqus Comments - Add your disqus short name to enable disqus comments on your site.
  • Google Analytics - Add your tracking id to enable Google Analytics tracking for your site.
  • Facebook - Add a Facebook like button
